conclusion: Understand how position and size of shadows change when light source moves backward.
Inverse Square Law: Light intensity decreases with square of distance from light source.
Shadow position determined by relative positions of objects and light source.
As light source moves backward, shadows move forward on the ground.
Size of shadow is directly proportional to distance of object from light source and inversely proportional to distance of shadow from light source.
Shadow A is cast by an object on the left side of the image.
Shadow A will move forward and become smaller as light source moves backward.
Shadow B is cast by an object near the center of the image.
Shadow B will move forward and become smaller as light source moves backward.
Shadow C is cast by an object on the right side of the image.
Shadow C will move forward and become smaller as light source moves backward.
Shadow D is cast by an object near the top right of the image.
Shadow D will move forward and become smaller as light source moves backward.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move forward and become smaller.
